Test Case Change Classification.Acceptance Criteria - Modified Content: Validate repository visibility settings (Public/Private) are applied correctly during creation and reflect the selected option post-creation.

Test Case Impact Details.What changed in Test Cases Steps & Expec: New acceptance criteria added for validating repository visibility settings. No existing test case covers both the creation and post-creation reflection of visibility settings. A new test case is required.

test_cases.TC_Name: Validate repository visibility settings during and after creation

Steps.Step_Desc: 1. Login to GitHub with valid credentials. [Test Data- Email: valid@email.com, Password: validPassword] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
Steps.Expected_Result: 1. User is logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step_Desc: 2. Click 'New Repository' button. [Test Data- N/A] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]

3. Enter valid repository name and description. Select 'Public' visibility. [Test Data- Repository Name: 'public-repo', Description: 'Test public repo', Visibility: Public] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
Steps.Expected_Result: 3. Details are accepted and 'Public' is selected.

Steps.Step_Desc: 4. Click 'Create Repository'. [Test Data- N/A] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
Steps.Expected_Result: 4. Repository is created and displayed in repository list.

Steps.Step_Desc: 5. Verify that the created repository is marked as 'Public' in its settings and UI. [Test Data- Repository Name: 'public-repo'] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
6. Repeat steps 2-5 for 'Private' visibility. [Test Data- Repository Name: 'private-repo', Description: 'Test private repo', Visibility: Private] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
